basics.name: Zachary Dow
basics.label: Web Application Developer
basics.summary: Web application developer with over 9 years of experience working on all layers of the stack. Deeply passionate about Typescript, Node, React, and .NET. Highly flexible with a strong desire to learn and keep up with best practices, tools, and languages. Collaborates well with others regardless of technical background.

work.name: Neighborly
work.summary: Handled many developer roles from managing public facing CMS systems, internal and external HTTP APIs, web applications, background services, and CI/CD devops. Moderate emphasis toward the front end of the stack.
highlights: Lead a website redesign and rewrite of mollymaid.com with ASP.NET MVC in Sitecore.
Created RESTful APIs with Entity Framework and OData to create dynamic endpoints.
Picked up Typescript and Sass to make simpler, modular front end code.
Implemented AngularJS, and later StencilJS for an internal portal website.
Built windows services in C# to synchronize data with vendor apis.
Transitioned gift certificate e-commerce system to another payment provider.
Set up a CI/CD pipeline in Azure Devops for builds and deployments.

work.name: CareTech Solutions
work.summary: Enhanced and maintained websites for hospital clients on a proprietary ASP.Net WebForms CMS system. Communicated frequently with clients about issues and enhancements to their websites.
highlights: Worked in a 4-6 person developer team and aided other teams in need
Completed larger scale projects including redesigns, CMS upgrades, and new features
Learned Linq to Sql, Mercurial, Responsive Design, and JQuery

work.name: Spider Development
work.summary: Hired as an employee after a ten week internship. Started off creating ASP.Net e-commerce sites for clients with Spider Development. Shifted focus to upgrading SnappyEats.com site from Classic ASP to ASP.NET.
